intro: Agathophora iraqensis, commonly known as the Iraq sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves adapted to drought conditions. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, semi-desert environments. Its botanical features include a low-growing habit and a system of shallow roots that help it conserve water. Agathophora iraqensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to extreme climates.
